intro: Erigeron villarsii proles mixtus, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its foliage is generally gray-green with hairy surfaces, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
